page.title: 10Religion in Glastonbury
page.content: At the heart of the town are the ruins of one of the greatest abbeys of Britain. Nearby is a mineral spring {(Chalice}Well),possibly a sacred place in pagan times, and the{Tor}with its mysterious terraces,topped by a ruined church tower. Glastonbury still draws great numbers of seekers of all kinds. An Anglican Pilgrimage, attended by several thousand, and a Roman Catholic Pilgrimage are annual events. Essenes, Druids and others come here to perform their rites. There are two Anglican churches,one,an Anglo-Catholic with fine musical trad- ition;a Roman-Catholic, a Methodist, a United Reform Church,a Gospel Hall, and Christian Fellowship; also British Israelites and a branch of the British Meditation Society. Abbey House run by the Sisters of Charity is used for retreats and conferences.
